intro: Brickellia cymulifera, commonly known as the narrowleaf brickellia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which is characterized by its composite flower heads composed of many small florets. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Its leaves are narrow and gray-green, with a rough texture, and it produces showy yellow-orange flowers in the spring. Brickellia cymulifera is often found in open woodlands and along rocky slopes, where it thrives in full sun.
